content: The "American Family Act of 2017" establishes a fully refundable Child Tax Credit by eliminating the existing Child Tax Credit and inserting a new section 36C in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "American Family Act of 2017" introduces a fully refundable Child Tax Credit under section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit allows for $3,000 for qualifying children aged 6 and above, and 120% of the dollar amount for those under 6 years old. The Child Tax Credit under section 151 allows for $3,000 for qualifying children aged 6 and above, and 120% of the amount for those under 6 years old. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is the adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under specific sections.
